skill.name: github-code-review
skill.description: Comprehensive GitHub code review with AI-powered swarm coordination
skill.summary: Comprehensive GitHub code review with AI-powered swarm coordination
skill.author: Claude Code Flow

security_audit.summary: The skill requires GitHub CLI and network access for PR operations. It executes external commands and has filesystem access for code analysis. While legitimate for code review purposes, the broad capabilities warrant medium risk classification.

medium_findings.title: External command execution via GitHub CLI
medium_findings.description: The skill executes numerous gh CLI commands that could be manipulated if input validation is insufficient. Examples include: 'gh pr view 123 --json files,diff' and 'gh pr comment 123 --body'. While legitimate for PR operations, command injection could occur if PR data is not properly sanitized.

medium_findings.title: Network calls to GitHub API endpoints
medium_findings.description: The skill makes extensive API calls to GitHub endpoints including '/repos/:owner/:repo/pulls/123/comments'. These network operations could potentially be redirected or intercepted if the system is compromised.

low_findings.title: Webhook handler executes commands directly
low_findings.description: The webhook handler example uses execSync to execute swarm commands based on PR comments: 'execSync(`npx ruv-swarm github handle-comment --pr ${event.issue.number} --command "${command}"`)'. This could be exploited if comment validation is insufficient.

content.user_title: Automate GitHub code reviews with AI swarm intelligence
content.value_statement: Manual code reviews are time-consuming and inconsistent. This skill deploys specialized AI agents that analyze security, performance, architecture, and style in parallel, providing comprehensive feedback faster than human reviewers.
actual_capabilities: Deploy multiple specialized review agents in parallel
Analyze security vulnerabilities with OWASP checks
Evaluate performance impact and optimization opportunities
Enforce coding standards and architectural patterns
Generate contextual review comments with fix suggestions
Integrate with GitHub CLI for seamless PR workflow
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI authentication and repository access
May generate false positives requiring human verification
Limited to repositories with GitHub CLI support

use_cases.title: Scale code review capacity
use_cases.description: Handle multiple PRs simultaneously with specialized agents focusing on security, performance, and code quality aspects.

use_cases.title: Maintain quality standards
use_cases.description: Ensure consistent review quality across all contributions with automated checks for security and style compliance.

use_cases.title: Enforce compliance requirements
use_cases.description: Automatically validate code against organizational standards and regulatory requirements before merge.

prompt_templates.title: Basic PR Review
prompt_templates.scenario: Review a simple bug fix PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Review PR #123 for a bug fix in the authentication module. Check for security issues, test coverage, and code style compliance.

prompt_templates.title: Security-Focused Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform comprehensive security review on PR #456 affecting payment endpoints. Check for SQL injection, XSS, authentication bypasses, and secret exposure.

prompt_templates.title: Performance Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze PR #789 for performance impact on database queries. Check for N+1 queries, missing indexes, caching opportunities, and memory usage.

prompt_templates.title: Architecture Validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Evaluate PR #321 implementing a new microservice. Check SOLID principles, dependency management, API design, and integration patterns.

output_examples.input: Review PR #456 for security vulnerabilities in authentication code
output: Issue: API key stored directly in source code
Fix: Move to environment variable: process.env.API_KEY

best_practices: Configure review thresholds appropriate for your team's maturity level
Use incremental reviews for large PRs to avoid overwhelming feedback
Train agents on your codebase patterns to reduce false positives
anti_patterns: Relying solely on automated reviews without human oversight
Running all agents on every PR regardless of change scope

faq.question: Which GitHub repositories are compatible?
faq.answer: Any repository with GitHub CLI access. Private repos require appropriate token permissions.

faq.question: How many agents can run simultaneously?
faq.answer: Up to 54 specialized agents can coordinate, with automatic topology selection based on PR complexity.

faq.question: Can this integrate with existing CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes, it works alongside existing workflows through GitHub Actions or direct CLI integration.

faq.question: Is my code data safe during review?
faq.answer: Reviews happen locally using your GitHub CLI authentication. No code is sent to external services.

faq.question: How do I handle false positives?
faq.answer: Configure review rules and thresholds. Agents learn from feedback to improve accuracy over time.

faq.question: How does this compare to GitHub's built-in reviews?
faq.answer: This provides multi-dimensional analysis with specialized agents, contextual suggestions, and automated fixes beyond basic GitHub reviews.
